Submodules¶

simpleml.kmeans module¶

class simpleml.kmeans.KMeans(n_clusters: int, iterations: int = 1000)¶

Bases: object

Class for the NumPy simplified implementation of K-means.

Parameters

  • n_clusters (int) – Number of clusters used to segment the data.

  • iterations (int, optional) – Maximum number of iterations for the model.

  • data (np.ndarray) – Input data to cluster.

  • centroids (np.ndarray) – Final centroids locations

fit(data: numpy.ndarray) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]¶

Returns the locations of the centroids and the cluster identity of each point of the input data.

Parameters

data (np.ndarray) – Input data to cluster

Returns

location of the centroids and the cluster ids.

Return type

tuple with the centroids (NumPy array) and cluster ids (NumPy array)

k_means_loop(data: numpy.ndarray, centroids: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶
Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – Input data to cluster

  • centroids (np.ndarray) – Current centroids locations

Returns

cluster id for each point

Return type

np.ndarray

predict(data: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns the cluster identity of each of the points from the input data, using the centroids previously obtained by fitting the training data.

Parameters

data (np.ndarray) – Input data to cluster

Returns

Cluster identity of each point of the input data.

Return type

np.ndarray

simpleml.linear_regression module¶

class simpleml.linear_regression.BaseModel¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract Model Class used as interface of all regression models.

Parameters

  • model (np.ndarray) – Stored model data (NumPy array in most cases)

  • data (np.ndarray) – input data for training or testing

  • labels (np.ndarray) – labels of the input data for training

fit(data: numpy.ndarray, labels: numpy.ndarray)¶
Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – input data for training

  • labels (np.ndarray) – labels of the input data for training

predict(data: numpy.ndarray)¶
Parameters

data (np.ndarray) – input data for testing

Returns

predicted data

Return type

np.ndarray

class simpleml.linear_regression.ConstantModel¶

Bases: simpleml.linear_regression.BaseModel

Constant model class that uses the average of each feature as prediction.

Parameters

  • model (np.ndarray) – Stored model data (NumPy array in most cases)

  • data (np.ndarray) – input data for training or testing

  • labels (np.ndarray) – labels of the input data for training

fit(data: numpy.ndarray, labels: numpy.ndarray) → None¶

Method for fitting the training data and determining and storing the model parameters. In this case the model returns always the data average.

Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – input data for training

  • labels (np.ndarray) – labels of the input data for training

Returns

None

predict(data: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Given the input data it returns the predicted output for each input point using the model, in this case the average.

Parameters

data (np.ndarray) – input data for testing

Returns

predicted data

Return type

np.ndarray

class simpleml.linear_regression.LinearRegression¶

Bases: simpleml.linear_regression.BaseModel

Linear regression model class that uses the following model for predictions: .. math:

y = \omega*X
fit(data: numpy.ndarray, labels: numpy.ndarray) → None¶

Method for fitting the training data and determining and storing the model parameters \(\omega\).

Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – input data for training

  • labels (np.ndarray) – labels of the input data for training

Returns

None

predict(data: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Given the input data it returns the predicted output for each input point using the model, in this case:

\[y = \omega*X\]
Parameters

data (np.ndarray) – input data for testing

Returns

predicted data

Return type

np.ndarray

class simpleml.linear_regression.LinearRegressionWithB¶

Bases: simpleml.linear_regression.BaseModel

Affine regression model class that uses the following model for predictions:

\[y = \omega*X + b\]
fit(data: numpy.ndarray, labels: numpy.ndarray) → None¶

Method for fitting the training data and determining and storing the model parameters \(\omega\) and b.

Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – input data for training

  • labels (np.ndarray) – labels of the input data for training

Returns

None

predict(data: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Given the input data it returns the predicted output for each input point using the model, in this case:

\[y = \omega*X + b\]
Parameters

data (np.ndarray) – input data for testing

Returns

predicted data

Return type

np.ndarray
